author: aldcroft
description: The last year has seen tremendous progress in multi-platform scientific Python package installations.  It's getting easier and easier for users to get up and running with a full-featured Python installation in minutes.  There is perhaps a healthy competition between big hitters Anaconda (from Continuum Analytics) and Canopy (from Enthought), with the real winner being us the users.  Both have a nice package manager and a deep library of scientific packages to do your heavy lifting.  Both make it easy to create distinct environments so you can easily test different packages while maintaining a stable production environment.  And most importantly, both include Astropy!So have no fear when it comes to installing Python or helping your colleagues to do the same.  Note that there are a number of other excellent scientific Python installations that you'll find with a little searching, and these may well fit your needs even better!
title: Anaconda and Canopy
